 Construcs a WSP consisting of two comp_quad_tree_node elements.

 returns the number of points in the WSP
double get_bccp_dist () const
 returns the currently computed BCCP distance
bool bccp_done () const
 returns true if the actual BCCP has been computed, false otherwise
WSP< Point > & operator= (const WSP< Point > b)
 Assignment operator.
void bccp ()
 computes the BCCP if it has not been For WSPs of small size (<32) this computes the BCCP by brute force. Otherwise it calls a recursive algorithm.

Public Attributes

void * first
 Indicates either the first quadtree box, or point Initially, this pointer indcates the comp_quad_tree_node that is the first half of the well-seperated pair. After the BCCP is calculated, this because a pointer to a point, indicating it is half of the BCCP.
void * second
 Indicates either the second quadtree box, or point Initially, this pointer indcates the comp_quad_tree_node that is the second half of the well-seperated pair. After the BCCP is calculated, this because a pointer to a point, indicating it is half of the BCCP.
double bccp_dist
 Indicates either the BCCP distance, or the marginal BCCP distance If this value is negative, it indicates the current minimum possible BCCP distance known. If it is positive, it indicates the actual BCCP distance.

Detailed Description

template<typename Point>
class WSP< Point >

Implements functions needed by a Well Seperated Pair object.

Well Seperated Pair

Member Data Documentation

template<typename Point>
double WSP< Point >::bccp_dist

Indicates either the BCCP distance, or the marginal BCCP distance If this value is negative, it indicates the current minimum possible BCCP distance known. If it is positive, it indicates the actual BCCP distance.

bccp_dist

template<typename Point>
void* WSP< Point >::first

Indicates either the first quadtree box, or point Initially, this pointer indcates the comp_quad_tree_node that is the first half of the well-seperated pair. After the BCCP is calculated, this because a pointer to a point, indicating it is half of the BCCP.

first

template<typename Point>
void* WSP< Point >::second

Indicates either the second quadtree box, or point Initially, this pointer indcates the comp_quad_tree_node that is the second half of the well-seperated pair. After the BCCP is calculated, this because a pointer to a point, indicating it is half of the BCCP.

second
